page.title: 04Local History
page.content:
{BOLSOVER PARISH CHURCH
The church was founded in Norman times but was rebuilt after a serious fire in 1897. The west tower, dating from the 13th century, and the Cavendish Chapel, built in 1624, survived the fire. In the churchyard is a grave with a spelling mistake. On the gravestone it says 'in loviny memorg'.
{THE WHITE SWAN
One of the pubs in the Market Place dates from Tudor times. It was originally a house in which Courts Leet and Courts Baron were held. The old pub sign was a carving in an oak beam. The newer sign is of the same design but made out of cast iron. The Tudor style windows still remain.
